title: A Logic for Expressing Log-Precision Transformers. (arXiv:2210.02671v4 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: One way to interpret the reasoning power of transformer-based language models is to describe the types of logical rules they can resolve over some input text. Recently, Chiang et al. (2023) showed that finite-precision transformers can be equivalently expressed in a generalization of first-order logic. However, finite-precision transformers are a weak transformer variant because, as we show, a single head can only attend to a constant number of tokens and, in particular, cannot represent uniform attention. translated_title: 表达对数精度变换器的逻辑
translated_abstract: 解释基于transformer的语言模型推理能力的一种方法是描述它们可以在某些输入文本上解决的逻辑规则类型。我们分析了一种在长度为n的语境上计算前向传递的对数精度transformer，证明了任何对数精度transformer都可以等效地表示为一阶逻辑句子，而不仅仅是标准的全称和存在量词。
tldr: 本研究分析了一种对数精度transformer，证明了任何对数精度transformer都可以等效地表示为一阶逻辑句子，扩展了对transformer语言模型的解释。
